definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: be precipitate, precipitate (trans.) (cf. Ar. war=at.a conjecit, praecipitem dedit in puteum, exitium, Frey.)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[יׇרַט]] Nu 22:32, app. c. subj. [[הַדֶּרֶח]]; the way is precipitate, (RV:m headlong) before me, but transit. [[על־ידי]] [[רשׁעים ירטני]] Job 16:11 into the hands of wicked men he precipitates me (v. Di; [[יִרְטֵנִי]] = [[יִֽרְטֵנִי]]; Baer's text [[יִרְטֵנִי]] points to √ [[רטה]] q. v.); hence perh. rd. [[יׇרַטְתָּ]] Nu 22:32; thou hast precipitated the journey in front of me, i.e. rushed recklessly in front of me; v. Di; Kau:AT leaves untransl.
